Articles.Content:
I present to you me newest invention, the Kerbalwagen.

Now, you may be wondering just what this is.

It is a revolutionary new way to move rockets and launch them on the go!

Rockets can be launched from this in under 30 seconds!

There she is ready to move out!

In launching position!

Rocket away!

https://docs.google.com/file/d/0Bz5dXxgdW-KyUlc5dVM3dkxmaWM/edit

Order here today!
Ooh, that is nice, how did you do the pivot system?
:huh:How did you use the hinge system, at first I thought it was a counterweight and a decoupler, but now I'm not certain that is it.
I like the upside-down failed attempts in the background of the first two photos.
smart counter weight Idea. I imagine it release's with de-coupling or port. smart. nice job RedRobin

Ok, from what I see, the pivot is a structure tube that is sitting freely in a cradle. When the other end is released, by coupler most likely, it rotates bringing the rocket into firing position. I like this, great work here. To bad current game mechanics make it a one shot deal, but then again with how you have to reload each vehicle on shot is all you need.

That's a neat design for a Transport-Erector-Launcher. Is it able to launch while moving? I'd guess that you might be able to impart some extra velocity on the missile if the TEL was going fast enough.

Hey man, it look awesome. great!

Thanks, If you liked this, I also made one for my R-7:

EDIT: Woah, 1k views, thanks.

Edited February 3, 2014 by Redrobin
